title: AWOL Score for Delirium
description: Predicts risk of delirium during hospitalization using age, cognitive function, orientation, and illness severity

parameters.name: orientation
parameters.description: Oriented to city, state, county, hospital name, and floor

result.name: awol_score
result.description: AWOL score indicating risk of delirium during hospitalization

ranges.interpretation: 2% risk of delirium during hospitalization. Low risk patient - routine monitoring appropriate.
4% risk of delirium during hospitalization. Low risk patient - routine monitoring appropriate.
14% risk of delirium during hospitalization. Consider delirium prevention strategies (early mobilization, reorientation, sleep hygiene).
20% risk of delirium during hospitalization. Implement delirium prevention protocol and consider specialist consultation.
64% risk of delirium during hospitalization. High priority for delirium prevention measures, close monitoring, and specialist involvement.

references: Douglas VC, Hessler CS, Dhaliwal G, Betjemann JP, Fukuda KA, Alameddine LR, et al. The AWOL tool: derivation and validation of a delirium prediction rule. J Hosp Med. 2013 Sep;8(9):493-9. doi: 10.1002/jhm.2062.
formula: AWOL Score = Age points + Spelling points + Orientation points + Illness severity points
notes: AWOL stands for Age, World backward, Orientation, Illness severity
Designed to predict likelihood of delirium during hospitalization
